channel.title: [VB6] Block Madness! (First Game)
channel.description:
Hello, i'm posting here to show you all the game i just made, Block Madness. [img]http://xs138.xs.to/xs138/09152/screenshot1741.jpg[/img][img]http://xs138.xs.to/xs138/09152/screenshot2138.jpg[/img] The game involves 7 squares, you, an enemy, a bonus and four teleporters, your aim is to get the highest score possible before the enemy kills you, you do this by staying alive and collecting the bonuses.
Ps. It is possible to get a very high score by just waiting at a wall and going into it and back. (Can't think of a way to stop this)
Please comment :D
[b][Edit][/b] I've attatched the source just incase anybody is interested

item.title: [VB6] Block Madness! (First Game)
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Another suggestion is to change the dots to mini pacmans.

Bundy, I just gone through your posts and your such a troll!

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Block Madness! (First Game)
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

[quote=“Daed, post:10, topic:271756”]I keep trying to move away from vb6, you might notice i’ve posted threads about me turning to java and c++ a few times… but i always find myself back in vb6 because everything i want to create can be made much easier there.

And as long as it does its job i didn’t see the problem, at first i tried to make block madness in c# but i was having trouble doing quite a few things like pub variables.

Ps. Can we talk about the game aswell please[/quote]
Try remaking it with C#, and post any questions you have. I’ll be happy to help you out.

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Block Madness! (First Game)
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

I keep trying to move away from vb6, you might notice i’ve posted threads about me turning to java and c++ a few times… but i always find myself back in vb6 because everything i want to create can be made much easier there.

And as long as it does its job i didn’t see the problem, at first i tried to make block madness in c# but i was having trouble doing quite a few things like pub variables.

Ps. Can we talk about the game aswell please

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Block Madness! (First Game)
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

Hello, i’m posting here to show you all the game i just made, Block Madness.

The game involves 7 squares, you, an enemy, a bonus and four teleporters,
your aim is to get the highest score possible before the enemy kills you,
you do this by staying alive and collecting the bonuses.

Ps. It is possible to get a very high score by just waiting at a wall and going into it and back. (Can’t think of a way to stop this)

Please comment

[Edit] I’ve attatched the source just incase anybody is interested
